page.title: 09BIRCHLEY HALL
page.content: Birchley Hall,built 1594,is a three storied ,timbered manor house.The Hall structure has not been altered,but for minor details, since 1600. It has a chapel which was once Catholic and is now a non_denominational place of worship. The home of several wealthy families until 1975 it is now a Sue Ryder Foundation Home for the elderly,sick and disabled. The running costs are met from a Charitable Trust which is organised by Sue Ryder. The Trust finances many similar homes througout the world. The residents are cared for by nurses and other staff, their infirmity stops them from leaving the Hall and gardens they spend most of their time reading or watching T.V. One of the residents, Mrs. Redmond, 92 years old, spent her childhood at the Hall.
